sen.j: 新町通（しんまちどおり）は京都市の南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Shinmachi-dori Street is one of the major north-south running streets of Kyoto City.
The Shinmachi-dori Street is one of the major north-south running streets of Kyoto City.
The Shinmachi-dori Street is one of the major north-south running streets of Kyoto City.

sen.j: 北は玄以通から、南は京都駅で分断されるが、久世橋通の南まで延びている。
sen.e: It extends from the Gen-i-dori Street in the north to the Kuzebashi-dori Street in the south, though divided by Kyoto Station.
It extends from the Gen-i-dori Street in the north to Kuzebashi-dori Street in the south, though it is divided by Kyoto Station.
It extends from the Geni-dori Street in the north to Kuzebashi-dori Street in the south, though it is divided by Kyoto Station.

sen.j: 平安京の町小路（町尻小路）にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Machi-koji (Machijiri-koji Street) of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Machi-koji (Machijiri-koji Street) of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Machi-koji (Machijiri-koji Street) of Heiankyo.

sen.j: 町小路から新町通に名前が変わった理由ははっきりしない。
sen.e: The reason why the name was changed from Machi-koji Street to Shinmachi-dori Street is unknown.
The reason why the name was changed from Machi-koji Street to Shinmachi-dori Street is unknown.
The reason why the name was changed from Machi-koji Street to Shinmachi-dori Street is unknown.

sen.j: 京都府庁の東側と東本願寺の西側を通っている。
sen.e: It runs along the eastern edge of Kyoto Prefectural Head Office and the western edge of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.
It runs along the eastern edge of Kyoto Prefectural Head Office and the western edge of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.
It runs along the eastern edge of Kyoto Prefectural Head Office and the western edge of Higashi Hongan-ji Temple.

sen.j: 祇園祭で、御池通を西に進む山鉾が新町通で下がり、それぞれの鉾町に帰っていく、巡行の最後の経路にあたっている。
sen.e: In Gion Festival, the street is the last parade route taken by Yamahoko, Gion Festival floats: all the floats carried west along the Oike-dori Street turn south along the Shinmachi-dori Street and return to their own hokocho (towns with hoko, float).

During the Gion Festival, the street is the last parade route taken by Yamahoko, Gion Festival floats: all floats carried west along Oike-dori Street turn south along Shinmachi-dori Street and return to their own hokocho (towns with hoko, float).

During the Gion Festival, the street is the last parade route taken by Yamahoko, Gion Festival floats: all floats carried west along Oike-dori Street turn south along Shinmachi-dori Street and return to their own hokocho (towns with hoko, float).

sen.j: そのため、通の上を横断する電線が張られていない。
sen.e: This is why the street has no electric wires crossing the street.
This is why the street has no electric wires crossing the street.
This is why the street has no electric wires crossing the street.
